pageContext.claim: “I remember when Clinton wrote in his book all about the wonderful deal he made with North Korea. They started making missiles the next day and nuclear the next day.”
pageContext.analysis: President Bill Clinton negotiated the Agreed Framework in 1994, which put North Korea’s stash of plutonium under international supervision. There is no evidence North Korea started making nuclear weapons until after the Agreed Framework collapsed in a dispute with the Bush administration. During talks toward the end of the Clinton administration, North Korea agreed to a moratorium on new missile testing.
